thread.title: San Jose beats Sporting KC 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie
thread.title_full: San Jose beats Sporting KC 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie

author: wtopstaff
title: San Jose beats Sporting KC 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLS » San Jose beats Sporting… San Jose beats Sporting KC 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie By The Associated Press October 17, 2015 1:13 am Sporting Kansas City defender Matt Besler, top, goes up against San Jose Earthquakes forward Chris Wondolowski during the first half of an MLS soccer match Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in San Jose, Calif. (AP Photo/Marcio Jose Sanchez) 
SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) — Anibal Godoy slid in a goal early in the second half and the San Jose Earthquakes beat Sporting Kansas City 1-0 on Friday night to move into a fifth-place tie in the Western Conference. 
San Jose (13-12-8) is tied with Portland and Seattle with 47 points, while Sporting KC (13-10-9) is alone in fourth place with 48 points. 
In the 47th minute, Shea Salinas sent a cross to Chris Wondolowski, who one-touched it across goal to an open Godoy at the far post. 
San Jose is undefeated at home in its last five games and has not lost to Sporting KC at home since Aug. 16, 2000. 
David Bingham recorded his 12th shutout of the season to tie Vancouver’s David Ousted for second-best in the MLS. 
Sporting KC’s best scoring chance came when Benny Feilhaber chipped the defense, but Mikey Lopez’s wide open header went just over the crossbar in the 71st. Topics:
